main.name: Kabir Ansari
main.description: I am a highly motivated developer with an interest in learning new and existing technologies to bring a unique skillset to my work. I love to tackle new and exciting challenges that allow me to grow as a developer
main.bio: Recently graduated with Honours majoring in Computer Science and currently working part-time as a Java Developer. I have always been passionate about this field. I love learning new technologies while making sure to maintain a high level of proficiency in my primary ones. The current technologies and programming languages I have been using are Java, Spring, JavaScript, React, Node.js, HTML5, CSS, SQL, Git. Some of the ones I have used and maintain an interest in are C++, C, Python, PHP, Composer and many others. This website itself was created using React and NodeJS. My work experience as a Junior Java Developer has allowed to pick up critical industry related experience and a working proficiency in some of the important tools and technolgies as well.
main.contactmessage: I am currently open to all opportunities and if you would like to get in contact with me, please do not hesitate to send me an email. Cheers!

resume.skillmessage: As described above, my currently used technologies mostly consist of Java, JavaScript, React, Spring, HTML, CSS, SQL

education.description: Built my fundamentals of data structures and algorithms in my first two years. The next two years were learning industry tools and technologies like Agile software development, React, Spring, etc.

work.title: Junior Software Developer
work.description: Working in an environment employing the Agile scrum methodology and being deeply involved in the software development life cycle. Gauge and analyze business requirements and prepare solutions pertaining to the design and documentation of the application. Designing and developing microservice business components and RESTful web services using Spring Boot. Extensively using the core Spring MVC framework for dependency injections of components. Implementing controllers and models to render JSON response to front end application. Creating Hibernate mappings and debug issues related to data integrity. Collaborate with other developers to deploy and maintain the application using continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD). Developed a proficiency in Java EE and Java API (e.g., Collection). Identify user interactions to develop a responsive UI using React.js

work.title: Project: Student Information System
work.description: Developed a project that would show a live visualization simulating the effects of segregation throughout history. Implemented a machine learning algorithm based on Schellingâ€™s Model of Segregation in Python. Presented a live walkthrough of the project to students explaining the concepts used in the project

work.title: Project: AI Segregation
work.description: Developed a student information system using JavaScript, PHP, MySQL, Bootstrap. Allow students access to updated academic and financial matters (such as a transcript or balance statement). Implemented support for multiple universities through a functioning data warehouse. Implemented an ETL tool to store Data properly into the data warehouse. Added tracking for historical academic data through the data warehouse that would allow for complex queries

work.title: Videogame E-Commerce Platform
work.description: Developed a videogame platform using React, Node.js, Express, SQLite. Customers would be able to sign up and have access to a wish list feature. Implemented a shopping cart where products would be added, and customers would proceed to checkout. Managers would have access to add, delete or modify new or existing products. Supported advertisements that were displayed randomly. Developed using Agile methodologies.

work.title: Teaching Assistant
work.description: Helped students conceptualize various data structures by explaining it to them thoroughly and assisted them in implementing the data structures in a programming language of their choice. Also responsible for assigning students weekly coding challenges pertaining to the data structure that was covered during the time.

work.title: Teaching Assistant
work.description: Gave students constructive feedback on how to improve design aspects of their website and assisted them in implementing their website by helping them with HTML, CSS, SQL, and JavaScript.
